page.title: 05Gravel Extraction
page.content: The valley of the River Nene is rich in gravel which is needed to supply the building industry in Northamptonshire and the surrounding counties. Gravel has been extracted in small amounts for generations but with the increased needs for gravel and the use of much larger machines to extract the gravel there has been considerable controversy over the further extraction of large quantities in the Nene Valley below Great Doddington. The main concern has been the noise and dust caused by the extraction and the resultant large expanses of water that have left. Some of the land will be restored to agricultural use whereas other areas will be used for leisure. There is still considerable opposition in the Parishes of Wollaston and Great Doddington to further gravel extraction
